question: I am running a small business of courier business (PO boxes, Fedex, Ups, Dhl, Money order and Money Transfer etc)....
answer:
QUESTION

Mufti Sahib I live in California USA, and I am running a small business of courier business (PO boxes, Fedex, Ups, Dhl, Money order and Money Transfer etc), I am sharing the property with our another muslim brother who do the vehicle and home insurance in the same premises, I have started this business over one and a half year and there is no income I am getting  in from it truth is I am paying rent from my pocket, now I have decided to close the business but my friend who do the insurance business ask me to be partner with him in his business because he has open another location for the same business and he is short handed at this location. I want to know is this is permisable to do the insurance business in our religion or not. Please reply me so I can tell my decision to my friend. We will than merge both business and become a partnership.

ANSWER


Share:

In the name of Allah, Most Gracious, Most Merciful

Assalaamu `alaykum waRahmatullahi Wabarakatoh

It is not permissible to invest in a business that deals in insurance as this entails engaging in Riba (interest) and gambling.            
( Fatawa Rahimiyyah, Ad Durrul Mukhtar)

 

الربوا هو فضل خال عن عوض بمعيار شرعي لأحد المتعاقدين في المعاوضة. (الدر المختار)

And Allah knows best

Wassalam

Ml. Suhail Tarmahomed,
Student Darul Iftaa
